page.title: 10THE MARSH
page.content:
THE MARSH
There is a large area of salt marsh on the edge of Morecambe Bay. This has been changing dramatically over the past eight years. More than two-thirds of the grassland has been destroyed by the sea following a change in the channel of the River Kent which now flows just off Silverdale rather than on the Grange side of the Bay. The grassland is still used for pasturing sheep but in much reduced numbers and cutting of sea-washed turf for lawns has stopped. All the marsh now belongs to the RSPB and is a wintering ground for many types of wader and duck. Shell-duck and oyster catchers are common.
